name: format-shell

2.2.1.author: Peter Lyons <pete@peterlyons.com> (http://peterlyons.com)

shfmtPath.title: Path to shfmt executable
shfmtPath.description: Absolute filesystem path. If you do not have shfmt installed, you can [download a package for your OS here](https://github.com/mvdan/sh/releases).

indent.description: Indent setting for how your shell code is formatted. 0 for tab, 2 for 2 spaces, 4 for 4 spaces

simplify.description: simplify the code (-s command line flag)

binary.description: binary ops like && and | may start a line (-bn command line flag)

indentSwitch.description: switch cases will be indented (-ci command line flag)

spaceAfterRedirect.description: redirect operators will be followed by a space (-sr command line flag)

keepPaddings.description: keep column alignment paddings (-kp command line flag)

minifyProgram.description: minify program to reduce its size (implies -s) (-mn command line flag)

showNotifications.description: Do you want to see the success message?

showErrorNotifications.description: Do you want to see the error message?

2.2.1.description: Format your shell scripts automatically in the Atom text editor
2.2.1.name: format-shell

readme:
# Atom Format Shell

Automatically format/beautify/pretty-print your shell script source code from within the Atom text editor.

The formatting is powered under the hood by [shfmt](https://github.com/mvdan/sh), which must be installed separately from atom and this atom package.

You can install shfmt by [several package managers as documented here](https://github.com/mvdan/sh).

## How to use

There are two ways to format your code:

- Automatically **format on save** (requires enabling in _Packages → Format Shell → Toggle Format on Save_)
- Run the command _Format Shell: Format_ to invoke `shfmt` manually

simplify.description: simplify the code (-s command line flag)

binary.description: binary ops like && and | may start a line (-bn command line flag)

indentSwitch.description: switch cases will be indented (-ci command line flag)

spaceAfterRedirect.description: redirect operators will be followed by a space (-sr command line flag)

keepPaddings.description: keep column alignment paddings (-kp command line flag)

minifyProgram.description: minify program to reduce its size (implies -s) (-mn command line flag)
